data.title: Recommend bands similar to either New Order or OMD
data.meta_description: I´m listening to OMD's Architecture and Morality as I type and I think it's a brilliant album. Despite being recorded with synths it doesn't feel cold...
data.text:
I´m listening to OMD's Architecture and Morality as I type and I think it's a brilliant album. Despite being recorded with synths it doesn't feel cold at all and I love Andy's vocals. . I've heard the first 3 OMD albums and I think this is the best by far.

I'm a New Order fan, and I've heard most of what they've recorded. Technique is my favourite album by them. I love the combination of the guitar and the synths.

I need more music like this

New Order have been one of my favorites since I discovered them in 87. If you're looking for more of the synth type sound I'd suggest Pet Shop Boys, although some of their music can feel a tad cooler to me. Electronic, if you aren't aware of them, is a side project of Bernard Sumner, they have three albums, each a little different in character, their first self titled album being closer to the feel of New Order (followed by Raise The Pressure and Twisted Tenderness). Monaco was the side project of Peter Hook, and their two albums are well worth searching out (Music For Pleasure, then self titled album).

There's a band called The Mary Onettes that I found to be pretty similar in feeling to New Order, very 80's alternative sounding. Sample some tracks for their album Islands. You might like Sad Lovers And Giants, but they're a bit more guitar based.

I've heard a bit of the Pet Shops Boys' music. I have 2 albums by them, PopArt & Introspective, and I've downloaded their first 2 albums. I've also Heard the last 2 on Spotify. I like the first 2 best. The latest 2 sound soulless/lifeless to me.

As for Electronic, the only álbum of theirs that I heard is the first one, but I heard a later single that I like very much: Forbbiden City. And I like Dissapointed as well.

The only song I've heard by Monaco is What Do You Want From Me. It's not bad, but it's not great either.

I'll check out the other bands you mentioned. Thanks

Hi, the videos that you posted are blocked here where I live. Where esle can I watch them?

I know those 2 bands by name, but I've never heard their music so far.

As for The Other Two, I only know their 2 hits, Tasty Fish & Selfish, and I like them, but never bothered in investigating any further. I haven't heard anything by Revenge yet.

An obvious suggestion would be Section 25's From the Hip.

Section 25 - From The Hip

A lot of people I know that like New Order really like the Pet Shop Boys' Behavior album. It's a bit different than New Order, but worth a shot. I personally love it:

Pet Shop Boys - Behaviour

Although much more guitar driven than either OMD or NO, the first album by the Lucy Show would probably be of interest:

The Lucy Show - ...Undone

For a newer band, try Junior Boys' first one:

Junior Boys - Last Exit

A bit off topic from what we're talking about here but Reproduction and Travelogue are some of the best synth based albums of their time IMHO. They're totally different from what HL became later (watered down and commercial, original band members gone).
